    • canBeFiltered

      public boolean canBeFiltered(String lineToFilter, injector.InjectionHandler handler)
      This method tells whether a string can be filtered or not. If the string doesn't match the pattern then false is returned. Otherwise the string gets shortened to the regular expression it contains. Then the method checks for strings that contain a $number (needed to make sure it contains a capture group, strings that don't contain "\(" which is actually a parenthesis and not a capture group), and it excludes some other strings that may cause issues during parsing, such as octects or lookaheads. If the input string complies to the syntax described in these conditions then true is returned, otherwise false is.
      Parameters:
      lineToFilter - - line to filter.
      Returns:
      boolean - tells whether the input string can be filtered or not.
